description: {"blocks":[{"key":"bqdab","text":"The following protocol describes how to use a software package","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rp12","text":"containing implementations of various quantum gates and well-known quantum","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eh8og","text":"algorithms using PennyLane library. Templates within the package include all required","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"999vo","text":"elements from the quantum part of Shor’s algorithm, specifically, efficient modular","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ntp3","text":"exponentiation and quantum Fourier transform that can be realized for an arbitrary","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b8tla","text":"number of qubits specified by a user.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

journals.name: PLOS One
journals.citation: Antipov AV, Kiktenko EO, Fedorov AK (2022) Efficient realization of quantum primitives for Shor’s algorithm using PennyLane library. PLoS ONE 17(7): e0271462. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0271462

keywords: Quantum computing, Shor's algorithm, modular exponentiation, quantum Fourier transform, quantum arithmetics
manuscript_citation: Antipov AV, Kiktenko EO, Fedorov AK (2022) Efficient realization of quantum primitives for Shor’s algorithm using PennyLane library. PLoS ONE 17(7): e0271462. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0271462

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c4nvs","text":"First of all, you should install the PennyLane library using the regular python environment and set up the Jupyter Notebook's environment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d3gjj","text":"Content of the Github repository should be uploaded on your PC via the following link:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6gomm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8n9t","text":"https://github.com/Anatoly-Antipov/QuantumOperations","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":52}],"data":{}},{"key":"288ia","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bh9ua","text":"Files with the extension \".py\" represent original python code that realizes the software package with new useful functions built upon the PennyLane library. Functions from this software package are ready-to-use commands similar to PennyLane's functions and commands.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dt5q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6er29","text":"Files with the extension \".ipynb\" are Jupyter Notebooks that contain examples of the use of commands from the software package.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d6ns","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bdmmd","text":"See the README.md file in the repository to view an up-to-date description of included files","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D4B7B0B598A811EC86C00A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://github.com/Anatoly-Antipov/QuantumOperations"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"agmkp","text":"Use the file \"Example.ipynb\" or the file \"ExampleOrderFinding.ipynb\" to get the simplest example of the use of a new function. The file \"Test.ipynb\" contains the full list of newly introduced functions alongside the demonstration of its use in a Jupyter Notebook's environment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
